name: Grandma Schroeder's Rouladen
ingredients: Rump roast, sliced 1/8" thick against the grain
Bacon, raw, 1 piece per slice of meat

instructions.en: Spread each slice of beef with a little mustard (if using) and season with salt & pepper.
Top each slice with 1 slice of bacon and sprinkle with a little of the minced onion.
Roll each up to form a meat roll. Secure with toothpicks or string.
Brown the rolls well on all sides in hot oil in a skillet.
Place browned rolls in a roasting pan.
Cover the pan and roast at 350°F, just until you can smell them cooking.
Turn heat down to 300°F. Roast for 2 hours, turning them once to brown evenly.
Remove toothpicks, string or thread before serving.

notes: The number of servings will depend on the amount of meat. Grandma recommends 1/2 pound per person. The dish can be frozen. Traditionally, the pan is deglazed with hot water to make gravy, but serving with pan juices is also an option.
